author: potuz
content: Cc <@199561711278227457> since you run devnets that may need Bellatrix and builders. If that's no longer used I don't see any reason to keep Bellatrix support on mev boost

author: parithosh
content: We haven't tested capella genesis on a devnet yet, but Mario told me he has in Hive and it works with all clients. Since mev-boost testing is just for mainline (i.e, next defined fork and not stuff like verkle), we can be sure that we start from capella genesis.  So from our perspective, we should be fine to get rid of Bellatrix support.

content:
id at least keep a tag around <@388610194608750595> for the "final" version of each fork

e.g. if there is some security issue where we think nodes are running the last fork and we need it to test/debug

author: ralexstokes
content: but otherwise i can't think of a reason to keep the code around if it is simpler to refactor on each fork
